channel.title: Algebra everyone will find easy ('cept me)
channel.description:
Just started a new course at uni and they want me up to date with GCSE maths by the end of this week. I haven't looked at a piece of maths for about 2 and a half years now, and there are 2 Qs which I just don't get:
1. Solve the equation x[sup]2[/sup]+6x+8=0
2. Solve the equation x[sup]2[/sup]-7x+12=4x[sup]2[/sup]+5x-3
Yeeeeh i know these should be simple as fuck....
Methods would be perfect!
Cheers guys!

item.title: Algebra everyone will find easy ('cept me)
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Or just complete the sq if you don’t wanna factor it.

item.title: Algebra everyone will find easy ('cept me)
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

Teh Spede:

quadratic formula kthxbai

unnecessary, factoring is quicker and easier

  1. x[sup]2[/sup] + 4x + 2x + 8 = 0
    (x + 4)(x + 2) = 0
    x = {-2, -4}

  2. 3x[sup]2[/sup] + 12x - 15 = 0
    3(x[sup]2[/sup] + 4x - 5) = 0
    3(x[sup]2[/sup] + 5x - x - 5) = 0
    3(x + 5)(x - 1) = 0
    x = {-5, 1}

Read full topic
item.source: Algebra everyone will find easy ('cept me)
